title: Concert: Bonnie “Prince” Billy—SOLD OUT
description:
This event is SOLD OUT. A standby line will start at 7:00 p.m. at the Michigan Avenue entrance for tickets that become available.

Will Oldham, who sings and composes under the name Bonnie “Prince” Billy, has made an idiosyncratic journey through—and an indelible mark on—the worlds of indie rock and independent cinema over the past quarter century. With a highly individualistic approach to music making and the music industry that prioritizes intimacy, community, mystery, and spontaneity, he has captivated fans and has become one of today’s most influential and beloved songsmiths.

Join us for a raw, uncensored, and intimate performance by Bonnie “Prince” Billy celebrating the release of the definitive collection of Oldham’s lyrics, Songs of Love and Horror, which spans three decades of songwriting and features annotations that impart new meaning to his music. Louisville, KY folk duo, The Other Years, opens the concert. 

Presented with the Empty Bottle 

Support for Live Arts programming is provided by the Woman's Board of the Art Institute of Chicago.
